member_organisations:
Members are national IHE initiatives, European/national associations or national institutions and companies 
see  
http://www.ihe-europe.net/members/ihe-europe-members  
Companies participating in the Connectathon are not listed here. See  
http://connectathon-results.ihe-europe.net/view_result.php?rows=company&columns=integration_profile&subcolumns=actor&title=connectathon
fields_of_interest: Education and training, Business and Industry, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
- Identification of IHE profiles in accordance  the with Article 13 and Annex II (based on the WTO  standardisation principles) of Regulation (EU) No. 1025 /2012 (Validation in July 2015) 
- The Refined Health European Interoperability Framework (reEIF) endorsed by the Health Network 
- Digital agenda (DAE) and DSM 
- CEF: Connecting Facility for Europe
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
Non profit organization dedicated to interoperability in Health Information Technology. IHE-Europe gathers a large range of stakeholders to advance the share exchange of patient information.  
IHE-Europe engages clinicians, health authorities, industry and users to improve Healthcare interoperability by helping stakeholders to adopt, promote and implement IHE profiles. IHE develops tools and services for testing interoperability between IT systems.
relevant_communication:
- Contribution to EU projects: 
-EURO-CAS: Conformity Assessement Scheme for Europe in order to establish an European scheme aligned with the ReEIF and international scheme such as IHE CAS 
-eStandards: eHealth standards and Profiles in Action for Europe and beyond 
Contribution to the extension of the ReEIF (Refined eHealth Interoperability Framework with twi new use cases and several realization scenarios 
Report on cost-effectiveness of standards tools 
-epSOS: the project demonstrated the cross border exchange of medical data (Patient Summary and ePrescription) among European countries. 
-EXPAND: as a “continuation of the epSOS project” to the next step which is to launch of the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF).  
-Trillium Bridge:supported the extension of the cross border  European medical exchanges (epSOS) to US. The testing strategy that was developed was aligned to the epsom strategy. 
- HITCH:Health care Interoperability Testing and Conformance harmonisation project  
-Antilope: supported the dissemination and adoption of the eEIF and built  a refined eEIF with use cases and a selection of a set of 27 profiles. Quality management on interoperability testing, test methods were considered as well as a framework for supporting the development of a Conformity Assessment Scheme regarding HITCH recommendations. 
(...)
